column1: starts off with a length ball sliding down leg, looked like it clipped Hafeez's pad on the way through to wade. Umpire didn't hear something. Rough call, Pakistan are away
beauty! Draws him forward by bowling this full outside off, the ball nips away to beat the edge by a whisker. That just zipped through
too full, Hafeez gets forward and tentatively pushes it to the point fielder. May have found the gap had he tried to play it with a lot more authority. Was just feeling bat on ball there
in the lovely off stump channel, invites the drive but Hafeez lets it go. Some away movement and carry. Wade takes this sideways near the face
bowls this full and jags this one off the deck from outside off, Hafeez shoulders arms
gentle tap off the front foot to the man coming in from cover, just looked up, eye contact with his partner and they were off for the run. Excellent call from Hafeez
hops back into the crease and blocks the length ball on middle first up
too full and shaping away from off, eased into the gap between cover and mid-off
gets this to shape away, but too short and angled past the sixth stump or so, Sharjeel leaves and the keeper collects it on the bounce
beaten by a ripper! Short of length but there's steep bounce, Sharjeel pokes and misses by one that slants across at an angle he doesn't really want to be facing
thumped down the ground past mid-on. Too full and Sharjeel, who was camping inside the crease, crashed it. Not quite off the middle but still got enough on it
just short of square leg. This one's Sharjeel's trademark one-legged whip off his hip. Lucky for him that it didn't carry to Handscomb
sees this in his arc and lofts this over cover, far from the middle. The timing was off but he just managed to hit this over the infield for a couple
tucks him up with an indipper that hits him high on the thigh pad, or perhaps near the box. Played outside the line on that occasion
wrong line. Too full and angling down leg, Hafeez looks to tickle it fine but manages to get some pad alright, and that's enough. No chance for Wade on the dive
short ball on middle, Hafeez ducks under it. Whizzes through to Wade
swung this one a bit too far. Flirting with the wide line. Hafeez shoulders arms, fair call from the umpire
moves this one away from outside off, this one's just inside the wide line. Hafeez watches this through to the keeper
full and swinging away from middle this time, Hafeez gets half forward and taps it gently
lovely square drive, opened the face of the bat late to ease it behind point. Third man comes around to cut that off
whipped past the diving midwicket fielder. Picked the length early and went back into the crease to make that shot possible
pushes hard at a length ball on middle, gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
pulled, and pulled imperiously. Plenty of wood on that as it sails over square leg. Too short. Sharjeel had already decided he'd go through and he executed it well too. Super timing!
draws the edge this time, and third man can't get there. Handy runs for Sharjeel, frustration for Stanlake. This was a gentle push, and it just raced off the bat past second slip
cracking shot, between cover and point. Too full, Sharjeel leans forward and slices this up and over the infield. This should get Australia thinking. The intent is right from Sharjeel
wristy whip wide of mid-on. Not all that full, but Sharjeel went through with the stroke and found the gap even though he didn't time it as well as he would have liked

there's the first wicket and it's plumb. Hafeez slaps his pad in disappointment. He plays all around a full incoming delivery on middle and misses. Hazlewood didn't even bother appealing till very late because he knew Hafeez was stone dead there. Respite for Australia after a pulsating start. Hafeez fell over and when he did so, the leg stump was visible. An umpire needs no more proof
gets forward and defends solidly to cover
slips a short ball in but this was down leg side, Azam looks away as he ducks. Hazlewood can't believe that has been called wide.
crunching square drive, that is isn't four is only because of Faulkner's athleticism. Runs around from third man, at least 20 yards, before dishing in a full stretch dive to cut that off
firm drive down to mid-on, not all that full but he offered the full face of the bat nonetheless
quality stroke from a quality batsman. Not a leg stump half volley by any means. This was length on middle but Azam brings his wrists into play to punch that into the gap at midwicket. All class
gets forward and pushes this to mid-off
crashed to point, Maxwell leaps high to effect a one-handed stop. Saved four runs
beaten by a ripper. Gets this to jag away ever-so-slightly from length on middle, Sharjeel plays with an angled bat, didn't miss the edge by much
looks to whip this off his hip but the ball hits him off the top edge on the grille off the helmet. Ouch, he's checking to see if his visor is okay.
slashes and misses. Was too full for him to try that stroke
too short and way down leg, umpire reckons it was inside the wide line. Not too sure, Stanlake gets away
waist-high full toss outside off, Sharjeel looks to slap this past cover, hits it off the toe end to mid-off instead. Two poor deliveries and he's gotten away this time
good length delivery on off stump, Azam plants his foot forward and defends solidly to the off side
half shout for lbw, but this was an instinctive reaction. The ball was angling into middle and leg, hit him high on the thigh pad

uppish but safe. Looks like the bat face turned in his hand as he looked to drive, between point and gully. Third man comes around to cut that off. This is the 'in-between' length that makes Hazlewood dangerous
rip roaring bouncer out of frustration perhaps. Azam comfortably ducks under it
solidly behind the line of that incoming short of length delivery
this is a beauty! Swerves away late, Azam was drawn into the drive and is lucky the delivery was too good to find the edge. Wow, cracking stuff this.
gets on top of the bounce and works it off his hip to deep square leg
floats this full on off from wide of the crease, eased to mid-on
plants his front foot forward and drives through the line to cover
too short and way over the batsman's head, Azam ducks under it again
short of length delivery outside off, left alone. This one touches 145.6kph

this is angled full and into the batsman from wide of the crease, Azam looks to work it leg side and has been saved by a thick inside edge. The impact was in line and would have gone on to hit if not for an inside edge.
hustled for pace as he goes back to whip it away, deflects off the thigh pad to the leg side and they steal a leg bye
play and a miss. Looks for an expansive cut, and when he decided to pull out, the ball had already passed the bat. High 140s again, this time from Cummins
firm push but can't beat mid-on there. Hazlewood does well
not too full for the cut, chops it to point
plants forward confidently and defends the length ball to the off side
in two minds again. Not sure whether to play or leave, goes for it and then pulls out, but it was too late again. The ball had already passed the bat
whipped to deep square. Short of length delivery on middle, he was onto his toes to play that
stands tall to punch, gets a thick outside edge to third man
short ball at 143.9 clicks, but well down the leg side. Once again he's gotten away with it. That was a big wide, says Waqar on air. He's spot on.

did the edge carry to Wade? It was a thick inside edge of a mow over cow corner, played outside the line too. Lot fuller this time from Stanlake. There were two sounds. Some pad as well. Replays suggest it fell short of Wade
whipped behind square on the leg side. Bat, thigh pad and the deflection
stays inside the crease and bunts the short of length delivery to the off side
drops it into the off side gently towards the man coming in from point
punched straight to cover point
quality stroke from a quality player. Punching through the line between cover and point. Warner sprints behind that and pulls it back in
way over the batsman's head, too short from Cummins outside off. This time it's called wide. Wade was airborne when he collected that
solidly behind the line of that full delivery on middle, eased back down to the bowler
gets half forward and punches the away-going length delivery to cover
too short, another wide. Looking to test the bounce of the surface, is he? This was way down leg side and the correct call
stands tall and punches it past the diving point fielder for an easy single
swivels back and pulls him to deep fine leg. Cummins misfields but recovers quickly to keep it to a single
not there for the cut. Too full, not much width as well, the ball shaves past the inside edge
looks to force one through cover, gets an inside edge that rolls past leg stump, Wade does well to run to his left and stop that. No feet movement there from Azam
didn't get underneath the delivery, looked to slap that down the ground past mid-off
slower delivery, was through with the flick, except this time there was more bounce and was hit on the thigh pad as a result
stays inside the crease and dabs the away-going length ball to the off side. Excellent comeback this from Stanlake
bangs a short ball outside off, Azam gets on top of the bounce and fends it to the off side
driven through the line to Warner at mid-off, chances his arm and takes off for a single, the throw is fired to the striker's end. Sharjeel was well in
ripper of a delivery that nips away late to beat Sharjeel's flirty push. Played inside the line of that delivery
stands tall and punches the short of length delivery to cover
good bouncer on middle and off, Azam gets out of the way nice and early
bullet drive, but the bowler does well to put his right hand out on the follow-through and stop that
drifts one into middle, Sharjeel gets forward and blocks
that's the release he has been waiting for. Head errs in length, this one's too short, Sharjeel makes room and cracks it behind point. Poor effort from Cummins. First boundary since the fifth over
cramped for room, hit back to the bowler this time
gets forward and dabs the in-drifter back down the pitch
big, big shout for lbw. Sharjeel looks to get outside the line of the stumps and mow it over square leg, looks like he got a hint of bat on that. Australia have no reviews left. Close call though
leans forward and turns the full delivery to midwicket
mix-up, but sent back. Azam pushed this towards mid-on and was wandering down the pitch. There was a direct hit at the striker's end but he was just in
lucky break. Frustration for the bowler. No feet movement from Azam as he looks to thrash this over point, gets a thick inside edge to the fine leg boundary instead
gets on top of the bounce and works this to square leg
better technique, gets onto his toes and fends this to the leg side as they scamper a run
a misfield at mid-off by Warner gives them a single that shouldn't have been
sways out of the way of that quick bouncer on middle
tossed up on middle and leg, worked with the angle to long-on
pushed through quicker on middle, dabbed to the off side

width and he's crashed that into the deep point boundary. Warner it is again. Super effort to get there, sprinted 30 metres and then got in the dive, but couldn't stop it as the ball clipped him on the chest and deflected to the boundary
pulled wide of midwicket. That is a bullet hit, long-on was no more than a few yards from the delivery but he had no chance. Sharjeel on the move
thick edge that races past short third man. There's a half-century for Sharjeel. The fans are happy. He looked to crack this behind point

the party is over! Sharjeel looks to cut again, this time it was too close for him to play that. The drift in ensured he only managed a thick inside edge back onto the stumps. Celebration one delivery, frustration the next.
back of a length in the corridor, climbs up on top of the bounce and bunts it back to the bowler
good length outside off, puts a stride in and pushes it to covers
full length, angling in towards off, times the drive nicely but straight to mid-on
bouncer on middle stump, he's comfortably ducked under that
full and angled in on off stump, puts in a half-stride, gets a high elbow in and drives it past Warner at mid-off. Should've been three
good length on off stump, another half-stride, another push past Warner
around the wicket, good length, angled across, forward defence
drops it short and wide, cut away to sweeper cover
Uff! Angled across from middle stump and holds it's line. Outside edge falls safe
gives him the charge and hits it straight to cover
good length on middle stump, goes back and glances it to the right of midwicket
good length on middle, pushed feebly to midwicket
back of a length, angled across the left-hander, pulled away without any timing, goes to the right of mid-on
back of a length, slightly outside off, too close to cut but he goes for it anyway and hits it uppishly to third man
SHOT. Full outside off, gets behind the line and drives it down beautfiully. Deserved four there, bu mid-off puts in a good dive
good length, angled across off stump, pushed through the open covers region
good length outside off, waits on it and opens the face to run it down to third man
slower ball, good length on off, hangs back and stabs it down to third man
back of a length on off, punched to covers
floated up on middle, good stride, uses his wrists to turn it square on the leg side
good length, steps out and gets beaten in flight, pushed to midwicket
dropped short, pulled away to deep midiwcket
full outside off, hard hands, doesn't connect the cover drive well

GONE! Grade cricket batting that. Head loops it across him outside off, he steps out early, gets beaten in flight and doesn't know what to do with it next. Flails at it as it keeps drifting away and he can only get a top-edge, straight to short third man

Did that carry? It did and he's dropped it in his follow through. Good length on middle, pushes at it well away from his body and chips it back to Faulkner, who has to dive low to get to it. He doesn't. Instead, it clips his fingers and hits the stumps at the non-strikers, where Malik is just about in - with his feet. Poor technique, but he's still there.
back of a length outside off, chopped to third man
good length outside off, no feet, defended late
gets a stride in this time, defends the corridor ball to covers
good length, angled across the batsman, left alone
good length, angled across, no feet movement again as he throws his hands at this. Gets an inside edge and the fine leg fielder's dive only gives the ball momentum to hit the rope
good length outside off, stretches forward, thick outside edge. Short third man puts in a dive to keep it to a single
floated on a good length outside off, forward defence
good length on off stump, pushed with soft hands to the covers region
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
floated in at off stump, forward defence
pushes it flat on middle stump, goes back and pushes to the right of short third man
Beauty. Good length, angled across in the corridor, and squares him up
back of a length angling across off, tries to cut this one but the bat turns, one bounce to cover
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, goes forward and pushes it nicely behind point. Wade has an unnecessary shy at the non-strikers where Fualkner isn't expecting it and gives away four extra runs
good length, off stump, front foot defence
back of  a length on off stump, defended
floated on middle, steps out but can push it only to midwicket
dropped short, driven off the back foot to long-on
WOW! You can keep looking at that on loop. Floated on off stump, he steps out and lifts it majestically over the bowler's head and whacks the sightscreen - which is a 103 metres behind. Gorgeous.
drops short on middle, swivels back and throws everything he's got into this pull shot, but it's only a single down to long-on
back of a length on middle, goes back and hits it aerially, but safely, off the back foot to deep midwicket
short on middle, backs away and cuts it late, straight to deep point
good length on off stump, nips back in slightly, defended off the back foot
short outside off, jumps up and doesn't quite time his cut. He wanted to keep that down, but it caught the top edge. One-bounce to third man
good length on off stump, puts a small stride across and pushes it wide of mid-on
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length on off, thick outside edge off his back foot defence and down to third man
back of a length in the corridor, tries to turn it through square leg, but inside edges onto the pad
back of a length on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length angled across him, goes back and pushes it late to short third man
What a player this guy is. Floated across him on a good length, steps out and hits it inside out over mid-off
good length on off stump, and he pushes it off to long-off, who he has just placed there with his previous shot. Good batting
dropped short on middle, gets deep and slaps it over midwicket
good length on middle, goes back and pushes it to square leg with soft hands
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length on middle, pushed off the back foot to midwicket
full on middle stump, tailing in slightly, driven firmly to mid-on
short and wide, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
good length, tails in again, and gets the inside half of his bat. To the right of mid-on. This movement is encouraging.
bouncer on off stump, Malik is happy to duck under this
short outside off, not wide enough for the cut, and he gets it on the inside half and into the pitch

CLOSE! Almost picked up my first commentary wicket. Walks across his stumps to this good length delivery, and catches it on his pads as he tries to flick it. Pitched outside leg though but trapped him right in front
short and too wide
walks across again, but this time gets bat on it and turns it down to fine leg
good length on off stump, small stride, defended
full and wide outside off, he wants to push this to sweeper for a single, but not feet. Thick inside edge back to the bowler
good length, angled across off, waits back and places it down to third man
back of a length outside off, chops it to deep cover off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, gets on top of the bounce and punches into the open midwicket region
back of a length on off stump, waits for it on the back foot and turns it down to third man. NINE NINE NINE.
133 kph, bouncer outside off, left alone
139 kph, full and angling in on middle stump, driven nicely to mid-on
EDGED! Strange shot that. Full outside off, no feet, tries to half-caress, half-drive that through the off side, but gets a big outside edge down to the third man boundary
AND THERE IT IS! Full outside off, drives it to mid-off and runs across. He's equalled Richards, Pietersen, Trott and de Kock as the fastest to 1000 runs in ODIs - 21 innings.
good length outside off, pushed to mid-off and takes him on, he rushes in and shies at the stump, overthrows again
back of a length on off, opens his face and turns it down to third man
back of a length, chopped down to third man
short on middle, angled across, jumps up and turns it into the leg side
good length outside off, pushed off the front foot between point and covers
134 kph, bouncer on middle stump and it flies well over the ducking batsman
good length, angled in at off stump, back foot defence
back of a a length outside off, turned down to third man and now he brings up his fifty. Pakistani cheers all round the stadium

GONE! 134 kph, good length in the corridor, and his poor feet movement have finally done him. Pushes at it with hard hands and gets a healthy outside edge. Wade takes it easily and that's Stanlake's first wicket in ODIs
full and angling in from outside off, big stride and shoulders arms
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, chops it into the pitch and scrambles to find it in the air. Doesn't pick it, but it loops safely over the stumps
dropped short outside off, cut away late and square, sweeper has to run 40 yards to cut this off
good length on off, pushed into the open off side infield
short and wide, slapped to deep cover
rotation is the order of the day. Good length on off, pushed through the off side

MISSED STUMPING! Umar Akmal obviously has a different plan than his cousin at the other end. Steps out to a good length ball outside off, his hands and eyes are looking for the midwicket boundary, but the ball has snuck through him and Wade hasn't collected that. Poor from both of them.
good length, front foot defence
back of a length, turned down to third man
OOOH! 140 kph, good length in the corridor, climbs at him and beats his outside edge
good length on off, defended nervously to point
it's Akmal time. Full outside off, tries to slice it inside-out but doesn't middle it, floats dangerously and falls safely behind cover
good length on middle stump, glanced off his hips
low full toss, tailing in on off stump, puts a small stride in and turns it across the line to deep square
slider across Akmal from around the stumps, he feels for the delivery and is beaten
quicker delivery outside off from around the stumps, he rocks back and blocks
short on middle and leg, nurdled to square leg for an easy single
darts this one on middle and leg, solidly defended back down the pitch
tipping over the bar stuff. There was a chance for Smith at short midwicket, but it was powerfully struck too. It was short, he rocked back to pull, would have been a beauty had he pulled that off
short, he rocks back and pulls this over the infield, towards deep midwicket
wow, that's a lovely stroke from Umar. This is a length ball on off stump, he brings those wrists into play to flick that one bounce into the midwicket boundary. Top shot
drops it gently towards backward point, looks for a single but is sent back
short outside off, he sways out of the way of that. Umpire thinks it was way over his head, good call
floats this full on off, Akmal gets to the pitch of the ball and bunts it to the off side
low full toss on middle and leg, turned to mid-on. It was almost as if he didn't expect that delivery
gets on top of the bounce and bunts it to the off side
that's the end of a fine spell. Short of length delivery outside off, he rides the bounce and dabs it to the off side
quicker delivery on middle from around the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
looks to turn it to the leg side, gets a leading edge that rolls back past the bowler and they steal a single
too full outside off, crunched to sweeper cover
slow turn on middle, worked to square leg
gets forward and eases it wide of cover as they complete a quick single

long, long boundary at deep midwicket, but it doesn't matter for Babar. Sees the flight, gets down on one knee, underneath the flight followed by the free swing to get the slog sweep over the ropes. Super shot, what confidence to play that stroke!
length ball outside off, he gets forward and blocks
awkward bounce but he does well to open the bat face late to ease it down to third man. He was initially trying to sway out of the way
looks to whip this over midwicket from outside off, but gets a thick inside edge onto the pad, the deflection rolls to the keeper
looks to punch this over mid-off, but it ends up being a flat hit to the fielder there, they steal a quick single
hustles him with a pacy bouncer outside off, Umar gets on top of the bounce and dabs it to the off side. Pressure building
looks to get out of the way of that bouncer but gets into a tangle as the ball keeps coming back into him and raps him on the glove.
opens his wrists nicely to ease that off the back foot to sweeper cover
back of length delivery on off from over the wicket, Akmal dabs it to Maxwell, who swoops in from cover to prevent the single
eased to deep cover as they jog a single
whipped towards the vacant square leg region, timed well and so short fine leg has to run back and come around to cut that off, excellent running
width and he's slapped that to deep cover, no more than a single since there's protection there. Cheer from the Pakistan fans as the 200 is up
beaten by a slower delivery. Deceptive change in pace without much change of grip
crunched off the back foot to Warner at deep point
hops back and across to work the short bouncer on middle to square leg
flicks a length ball into the gap at deep square leg, two easy runs brought about by strong, steely wrists
bouncer outside off at 140kph, he sways out of the way of that delivery

this is a rip roaring bouncer that leaves Wade flinging to his left to get a hand on that. Azam arched back to sway out of the way. The ball swung back in a long way after it passed the batsman. Wade has the presence of mind to flick the ball back and prevent the batmen from scampering a bye

dropped chance, would have been a stunner had he held on. This is a flat batted pull which he looks to swat over Cummins's head. He puts his hand out on the follow-through but catches like those should stick.
full outside off, pushed to long-off as they jog the single
shot of a man who is now seeing this like a football. Length ball on middle and leg, Azam brings his wrists into the picture to whip the ball up and over wide mid-on, one bounce into the boundary.
punched past the bowler to long-off as they take an easy single
slower and fuller on off, dabbed to cover for a quick single
short of length ball on middle and leg, tucked to deep square. Babar wanted the second and was halfway through, Akmal didn't move an inch
length ball on middle and leg, eased to long-on
angles a length ball on middle from wide of the crease, not much room for Akmal to work with, defended back down the pitch
short of length ball on off stump, he takes his bottom hand off the grip and defends that
hops back and opens the bat face late to run it down to third man
hint of width outside off is enough for him to chop that down to third man
hops back, eases it down to third man using the bowler's pace
looks to touch and run, but Hazlewood does well to hare across and prevent both batsmen from doing that
direct hit at the bowler's end would have resulted in Akmal's dismissal. Pat Cummins the fielder at point. Super pick up, rocket throw but just wide of the stumps
worked off his hip towards square leg for an easy single
too full outside off, squeezed to deep cover
on middle and leg, worked to the leg side as they complete an easy single
opens the bat face to run it down to third man, but doesn't have the width or pace to beat the man there, a single nonetheless
backs away and muscles the slower ball over cover, but on the bounce to the fielder. Didn't generate the kind of power he would have liked

that's an outstanding catch by Handscomb. The pressure has got to Babar, who looks to pull that in front of square. Doesn't get the elevation. Handscomb, running in from deep midwicket, had to take a split-second decision if he wants to go for the catch or risk conceding a boundary. He takes a couple of steps forward and then dives low and full length forward to complete a super catch. Gets his fingers completely underneath the ball even as it was dying. The third umpire has a look, but Babar is walking off.
goes back into the crease and turns the length ball to the leg side and scoots across for a single
stays inside the crease, opens the bat face and runs it down to third man
plays back to a delivery he was better off going forward, this was full and shaves past the outside edge
width on offer, thumped to deep cover
turns an incoming short delivery towards fine leg, good work by the tall and lanky Stanlake to get down low and stop that
top stuff, gentle nudge to the leg side to give the man coming in from deep square plenty of work. Sensible running

ah, time and again he can thrill with shots like those. Shot of the day, and this is a super shot inside-out over cover. Not a half-volley by any means. Pick the length and goes through with the stroke, 15 rows back. What balance, what timing. No brute force, all timing. Held the pose for the cameras too
back of the hand slower ball on middle and leg, worked to deep midwicket
looks for a tip and run towards point, but Akmal says no
looks to get on top of the bounce and defend but the ball cut back in to hit him on the glove and roll to the off side
back of length delivery on off stump, bunted to the man coming in from point
hangs back and deflects the length ball outside off to third man
slaps it to mid-off, intended to hit that over midwicket. Lobbed off the toe end of the bat
clever! Make room, uses the pace of the bowler and glides it wide of the keeper. Stanlake had no chance at third man
backs away and deflects the waist-high full toss on middle over point
bangs a short ball into the rib cage, he gets inside the line and nurdles it behind square
yorker on middle, squeezed to the off side
angles a length ball into middle and leg, turned to fine leg
looks to play a flat-batted pull but gets it high on the bat, just lobs over the bowler's head

reward for some super bowling. Sees the batsman advancing and hits the deck hard. The bouncer is too steep for Akmal, who can only glove it to the keeper in an attempt to run it down to third man. Another setback for Pakistan just when Akmal was looking good to eye a final flourish
hustled for pace by a bouncer angled into leg stump from wide of the crease, Rizwan is caught on the hop as he defends
delicate little dab down to third man for an easy single to get off the mark
width on offer, forced off the back foot to deep point

slapped over the infield, but that is an outstanding catch by Travis Head running backwards from mid-off. He had to be mindful of Maxwell running from cover, but the loud and clear call allowed him to back off. Having made the early call, aided by a head start, he kept his eyes on the ball and then flung himself forward to complete the catch. Never easy taking those, especially when you're running backwards, but wow, did he pull off a stunner or what. Pakistan are crumbling here after setting themselves up for a 300 plus total
guides it from the crease to point
cramped for room, beaten for pace as he defends to the off side again
super timing! Faulkner at third man comes around towards deep point to cut that off. It was just a glide using the bowler's pace
floats this full on off, the ball nips back in and meets a dead bat
chopped to point, Maxwell moves swiftly to his left to cut that off.
hangs back and looks to ramp it over the keeper's head, but is done in by the bounce. He was off balance too when he tried to play it
he comes into play immediately. Amir backs away and angles it down to there. Looked to play it wide of point initially
looks to force that off the back foot but can't get behind the line, awkwardly defends it back to the bowler
gets out of the line to scoop it over the keeper's head, but the bounce on the surface meant it was always going to be an arduous task
turns the incoming length delivery towards deep square. Warner was coming in but the two was always on, except he slipped while turning for the second
looked to swing that to Perth's CBD, but couldn't connect. Backed away to go over long on, cross-batted, nowhere near the pitch or the line. Beaten
caught on the hop as he looks to tuck it fine. Struggling to lay bat on ball at the moment. Hit high on the thigh pas this time

I'm sure even Rizwan has no clue how he has managed to scoop that fine over short fine. Shaped to play, but looked away so that he isn't in danger of being hit if there's a top edge. Somehow gets his willow to the line of the ball and the deflection bounces into the ropes
slash and a miss. Too close to cut, beaten for pace as well
onto his toes and whips it to deep square
hops back and turns the short ball on middle and leg to midwicket
both feet off the ground when the bat face turns to ease that to point
starts off with a back of the hand slower delivery from around the stumps, bunted back to the bowler. No room, no pace to work with
on the pads, turned to short fine leg
swings leg side, gets a thick inside edge that rolls to the off side
tap and run stuff. Turned towards midwicket, the boundary rider has plenty of work to do and can't beat the two batsmen to deliver
worked into the gap between midwicket and mid-on, Amir turns for the second but is sent back
slapped over the infield, but on the bounce to deep point. As far as last overs go, you can't get better than that
short on middle, backs away and punches it to point
angled in, short of a length on middle, climbs on him a little but he plays it late and gets a thick outside edge past slip
good length, flighted on middle stump, forward defence. No turn.
pushed flat on middle stump at good length, driven to cover
angled in short at middle, tries to back away and cut it again, gets an outside edge again, but this time it drops into the ground by the keeper's leg and is stopped by slip
flighted on middle stump, driven down to long-on
OOOH! Swings it away from outside off on a good length, draws Warner out, no feet, only hands. Swings past the outside edge
good length on off stump, doesn't shape away as much, defended off the back foot
good length on the pads, gets on his toes and whips it behind square
full on the pads, flicked to Imad Wasim at midwicket
good length angled into the pads, pushed to square leg. He hasn't bowled a single full one on off after that beauty first ball
back of a length, angled into the pads, pushed to midwicket
back of a length on off, pushed to cover
APPEAL! Drifted into the pad, lazy push as it, gets it off the pad and it bobs up for Sharjeel at short leg. Not out.
drifted in towards leg stump on a good length, gives him the charge and clips it over midwicket. Graceful.
fired in flat at middle stump, goes back and just gets bat on a cut shot he shouldn't have played
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
back of a length on middle, defended off the back foot. No turn whatsoever.
back of a good length, slightly moving away, lot of width, shimmies a little and throws his hands to slap in front of sqaure
back of a length on middle, pushed behind square and brilliant running
back of a length outside off, waits for it and punches it to cover
good length on off stump, but sits up like it should in Perth. Pushed to cover off the back foot
good length on off stump, trusts the bounce again and goes back, but it's lower this time and his attempted slice gets the inside edge and bounces away towards the leg umpire
back of a length outside off, slight swing away, left well alone

good length angled into the pads, Warner continues to stay back to that length. Tries to hoick it over square leg but gets caught in front of the stumps. Big appeal, but there might've been an inside edge
Oh boy. What a shot that is. Good length and angled into him again, and this time his trust of the bounce pays off. He whips it off the back foot over midwicket
slightly fuller outside off, crunched on the up through the covers
slower ball outside off, good length, he's into his shot early and has to check it
back of a length on middle, stands up tall and pulls it the right of midwicket, hasn't timed it but it's Malik giving chase and they push him to get three
back of a length on off stump, gets across and tries to pull it behind square, takes it in the mid-riff. Ouch.
FINALLY. A repeat of his first ball. Gets it nice and full, late outswing from off stump and beats his drive. Is that you, Wasim Akram?
Lovely. LOVELY. He's finally decided go full. Late swing away from off stump. Warner is nervous this time and just pokes at it. Beaten again.
good length on middle, swinging away and would have hit the top of off, but Warner has stayed back, played late and pushed it to mid-off to get off strike. Good batting.
full and swinging away outside off, left well alone
good length in the corridor and swinging away, he leaves it again
good length outside off, too wide, and left alone
back of a length on middle, pushed to midwicket. Junaid is bowling a tad too short as well.
good length, drifting into the pads, turned down to fine leg
good length outside off, driven on the up, straight to cover
good length on off, tries to turn it away to fine leg off the back foot as it nips back, catches him on the flaps, loud appeal but that's never going to hit the stumps on this pitch

CLOSE! Warner just makes his ground after Khawaja pushes a good length ball to mid-on and sends Warner back after taking off. Poor running from him. Malik dives and recovers quickly. Shies at the stumps and would've been out with a direct hit. But he misses.
full on off stump, punched back past the bowler off the front foot
good length, slight movement across, defended off the back foot comfortably
full and swinging towards middle stump from the pads, but he gets to the pitch and pushes it to mid-on
good length on off stump, swings away slightly, squares him up but he drops it into the off side with soft hands
full on the pads, clipped uppishly to fine leg
142 kph, and this time he brings it back in and beats the inside edge! Good length on off stump, no movement in the air but completely beats him off the pitch. He was playing for the one going away
good length in the corridor, shaping away, thick outside edge to third man
back of a length on middle stump, leans back and plays an ugly swat across the line. Gets an inside age and it just keeps running away from Imad Wasim and into the square leg boundary
TOP EDGE, CLEARS MID-OFF Another ugly swipe at an off stump ball, this time it's a top edge and goes well over mid-off
and, of course, when Junaid offers him a short ball, he lets it go.
slower ball, full on off stump, pushed to covers
back of a length on middle, pushed to mid-on off the back foot
Outside edge, gone! good length outside off, he pokes at it with no feet and tickles it behind for a simple catch. Junaid rewarded for maintaining his line
full outside off, marginal movement away, gets his eyes on top of this and drives it nicely to covers

superb from Amir! Good length, starts on middle and off, swings away and past the outside edge, and there seems to be a sound as it flies to the keeper. They appeal loudly, it's turned down. No review. Snicko shows a sound, but it is after the ball passes the bat
angled down leg side on a good length
good length, bending away from off stump, left alone
good length outside off, doesn't swing away as much as he expects and catches the inside edge as he swipes away from his body
good length, angled across the off stump, left alone
angled across the batsman on a length, left alone
full outside off, walks across, shows all his stumps and defends it
good length, angled well across the batsman, but he shuffles across and pushes to the right of mid-on
caught! But it's a huge no-ball! Full and pushed across the stumps, Handscomb swipes at it and edges it to second slip. It's the fortune he's had all summer - gets a free hit now

wow! Gets a bouncer, slaps it high into the sky, it comes down and plonks into the outfield, rolls for two yards, and stops short of the boundary. They run four. First runs in ODIs, should've been out for zero
back of a length, angled across, punched off the back foot and Malik puts in a dive at mid-off
138 kph, angled across him on a length, left alone
angled across on a length, left alone
full outside off, no swing back in, he shoulders arms
good length on middle stump, pushes forward and tries to defend, gets an inside edge that would've absolutely flattened leg gully, but fine leg is the only fielder who can get to it
back of a length, middle stump, defended off the back foot. Slight shape in
short and wide, left alone
beats the outside edge. Full and pushed across him, he goes for the cover drive and misses it. Bat slightly straighter than his previous shot and he's beaten instead of a nick this time
good length outside off, slight movement back in, lets it go
back of a length across off stump, shuffles across and pushes it to midwicket
full on off stump, defended nervously
full outside off, and he's using the Smith technique now. Walks across his stumps and defends
in the air - and safe. Pushed full across off stump, tries a big drive again, no feet, slices uppishly to third man
loud appeal for caught behind Not out and not reviewed. Full and wide, he shuffles across and tries to thump it through cover and snicko shows he might have edged that!
full outside off, leaves it alone on the angle this time
back of a length, swinging back in from outside off, goes for the cut and misses
good length, angled across him from off stump, goes back and uses soft hands. Thick edge between gully and point, and third man has to clean up
good length on the pads, goes back and turns it down to fine leg
back of a length on middle, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, angled away from him, shuffled across, gets behind the line and defends it
full outside off, walks across and plays an on-drive, straight to Hafeez
good length on off stump, fended into the off side. Three slips and a gully for Handscomb here.
good shot. Back of a length on off stump, goes back, gets in good shape and times it nicely past mid-off
edged, and falls short. Good length on off and he continues to be shaky in that channel. Soft hands this time and no danger
good length on middle, he's rooted to the crease as he defends that
dropped! Short and wide, sits up nicely, slaps it hard and straight to point at waist height. He has completely missed it. Mohammad Nawaz manages to get only a finger on it
back of a length on middle, pushed to mid-off
gets on top of the bounce and bunts one down to square third man.
shapes to cut, but there isn't much room. Chops it to second slip
width, but this time he's cut that straight to point.
floats this full and outside off, he opens the bat face to steer it down to third man
gets this to shape back in from wide of the crease, Smith squeezes it back to the bowler
excellent length, causing some confusion in Smith's mind. Bowls this full outside off, there's some inward movement. Smith lets it go
steps out and eases it with the spin to wide long-off
pick the gap. Just a hint of width, he rocked back and then opened the bat face late to craft that cut shot behind point. Super timing, played it really late.
those powerful wrists to the fore this time. Steps out, doesn't quite get to the pitch but fetches the whip from middle and picks the gap at midwicket. Delightful
drifts back into middle from around the stumps, punched back to the bowler, who misfields to give away a single that shouldn't have been
floats this down leg, Smith goes back into the crease to paddle it fine and misses
stays inside the crease and punches the flatter delivery to long off
gets a thick edge on that attempted square drive down to third man
hint of width, he steers it using the bowler's pace down to third man
through the gate! The in-dipper this time. He shapes to play a drive on the up but the ball keeps a touch low and clips the pad on the way through to the keeper
stays inside the crease, covers the line of that short of length delivery and defends
that is a lovely, lovely shot. There's cover, there's point but Smith adjusts well to punch that into the gap between both of them. Square third man comes around to stop it
gets a thick inside edge onto the pad as he shapes to slap that on the up through cover
tossed up on the pads, worked to midwicket
flatter one outside off, this skids straight on, bunted back to the bowler
pushed through quicker on middle and leg, turned to square leg
hint of bounce this time, touch short on middle, Smith wrists it to the leg side
gets outside the line of the stumps and defends
troubled by the drift, plays for the turn but this one goes away to take the leading edge, didn't lob to the fielder on the off side though
beaten for pace as he looks to turn it to square leg, the ball thuds into the thigh pad and they get a run off the deflection

that is a delightful drive on the up. Deep point had plenty of work, but I don't think he would have got to the ball even if he was Usain Bolt. Just a super stroke, planting forward and crashing it through the line. Impeccable timing
goes back and across to defend that in-dipper on middle
shoulders arms to a back of length delivery that nips back in from outside off

whipped from outside off towards wide mid-on, they were chancing a risky second and managed to even make it. The fielder there was caught napping, the throw was poor too. Hasan Ali got an awkward bounce. Shouldn't have been two
superb stop by Shafiq at cover, that was crunched
steps out, takes it on the full and works it to deep midwicket
effortlessly launched over long-off. Steps out, get to the pitch and lofts him cleanly over the ropes. Opened the bat face deliberately to play it there. Super stuff
nurdled wide of square leg for an easy single
steps out and bunts it back to the bowler, Hafeez dives over the ball but mid-off comes in quickly to stop the run
flicked with the angle to deep midwicket as they jog the single
punched to long-on
back of length delivery outside off, left alone
gets across the stumps and works it towards midwicket for a quick single
drops it gently into the off side with soft hands as they steal another run
pulls but was off balance when the ball hurried onto him, gets it off the toe end of the bat toward deep square
slides this into the pads, good work from Imad Wasim to stop that flick by running to his left from square leg
too short at 131 clicks, Smith pulls into the gap between deep square and deep midwicket
floated on middle, pushed back to the bowler
uppish and just past Hafeez's outstretched hands on the follow-through, down to long on
looks to play that fine bullet paddle, but can't get bat to it. Wide called, could have so easily been converted into a boundary
plays for the turn, the ball skids on to hit him on the thigh pad as he looks to whip that to deep square
drifts away, Smith has to adjust, initially looking to work it to long on, plays it back to the bowler instead
punched straight to square leg this time
goes back into the crease and punches it past the bowler as they jog the single
in-drifter on middle and leg, pushed to long-on for an easy single
steps out, the bowler fires it full and flat outside off, stabbed with the bat close to the pad
misfield by the bowler allows an easy single, should have stopped that straight push
slower through the air this time, some purchase off the surface, defended from the crease
rocks back and crunches this toward deep point, excellent work in the deep, big boundary, big throw
more work for deep point as he comes in to stop that cut shot
too short, he rocks back comfortably and bunts it down to long on for a single
steps out, gets to the pitch of the ball and turns it with the spin to Malik at long on
walks around the crease to throw the bowler off, Hafeez darts this short on middle and leg, blocked
pick the gap at cover. Didn't over hit it. Just rocked back, made room and crashed it through the vacant spaces. Looked no more than two when he first hit it but it kept travelling
too easy, short on middle, punched to long on
steps out and works it down to long on
steps out, the bowler sees him coming and fires it full on the pads, turned to deep square
punched towards long off, too easy at the moment. Percentage cricket
bowler half-stops it on his follow through, mid-on comes in quickly to prevent a single
slider that beats an attempted tickle, excellent take down the leg side by Rizwan
big appeal. He's played all around that in-drifter from around the stumps, but was a long, long way down the pitch. Line was very good
good work by the bowler, who dives to his left to stop that
excellent timing. Steps out and then brings those wrists into play to hit it a lot squarer than he would otherwise do. This one pick the gap between deep square and deep midwicket
gets outside the line of the stumps and bunts the full length delivery to the off side
steered towards point, didn't have much room to work with
gets on top of the bounce and crunches it to point
beaten by one that nips away and beats him on the drive. So far, Hasan was getting the ball to come back in. This is the first delivery he has got to go the other way.
crashed into the gap at cover, the boundary rider comes into the picture to cut that off
thumped down the ground, Hasan times his jump well to get one hand on it and take the pace off, deflects to mid-off
too full on middle and leg, eased to long on
straighter one on off, eased to long-off. Half-century for the Australian captain. Another responsible knock
makes some room and punches an in-drifter to long on
tossed up on leg stump, there's a hint of turn on this, Smith waits, waits and then blocks
this one keeps a touch low but Smith brings his bat down straight as it roll off the bottom half to long on
steps out and punches the full delivery to long-off, sensible.
half a shout for caught behind, but no noise, no deflection. He gets outside the line to help the short ball towards fine leg, and misses
arches back and steers it down to square third man
wristy little whip from outside off towards mid-on
gets across the stumps and works it wide of mid-on as they scamper a quick single
keeps low, but he goes through with the pull and pick the gap at deep midwicket
goes for the hook this time, a real tester for deep midwicket this time. Malik does well to run around and pull it back in
in-drifter on middle, eased to long on as they jog the single
plays for the turn but this keeps coming back in with the arm, defended back to the bowler
looks for that bullet paddle by going back deep into the crease and trying to generate power with the sweep, but it was fired down leg and he missed it by the time the bat came down
turned with the angle to deep square leg
chips down the track and whips it uppishly to deep midwicket
a misfield at square leg gives them two. More frustration for Pakistan. The 100-run stand is up
spongy bounce this time, stops on Smith, who readjusts to defend instead of trying to work it leg side
good length on middle stump, driven down firmly but he stops it from going to long-off
makes room, gets followed, but it is still short and he can slice this through backward point
floated wide outside off, bat turns in his hands as he drives it down to long-off
follows him down the leg side again, this time it's fired in full, he clips it to deep midwicket
short on middle stump, goes back and tucks it to the right of midwicket and to the deep fielder
superb placement. Pushed across him on a good length, wide outside off, he gets down on one knee and drags it behind square with a sweep
floated in full on middle stump, driven down to long-on
fired in on good length at middle stump, gives him the charge and flicks it to the left of deep midwicket
tossed up on middle stump, gives him the charge again and turns it into the leg side to bring up his fifty
back of a length on the pads, glanced to square leg
good length on off stump, coming into the batsman, inside edge on to pad and balloons up to where short leg would've been
drops it short outside off, cut away to short third man, and he misfields low to his right
good length on the pads, flicked to square leg
drops it short and wide, chopped off the back foot to sweeper cover
good length on middle, steps down the track and pushes it to long-on
clears his front leg, then brings it back in place, and still has enough time to wait for this full delivery on his pads and slog it past square leg
back of a length on the pads, turned off the hips to the left of short fine leg
full outside the leg stump, makes room and drives through the covers
78 kph, flighted on a good length outside off, soft-handed down to short third man
79 kph, flighted on a good length at off stump, defended off the front foot
drifts down the leg side this time, and he sweeps it cleanly between square leg and short fine
dropped short, cut behind point, sweeper comes across
floated onto the pads, turned away off the front foot to short fine, bit of a mix up but it's all safe in the end
full on off stump, tries to drive it down to long-off. Imad gets across and throws it back at Smith, who has to duck quickly. He's not happy about that.
short of a length on middle, deviates across him. He opens the face and runs it down to third man
angled across the batsman, short of a length, he shuffles well across and pokes it point who has a shy at the non-strikers. No danger there
full and moving away from off stump, shuffles slightly and leans into the drive and threads it between extra cover and mid-off
good length on off stump, walks across the stump, turns it into the leg side. It's too easy for him right now

129 kph, rolls his fingers on this bouncer that goes across Handscomb. He goes for the hook and gets a top edge. No one is even disappointed anymore - it's a Handscomb top edge, so obviously it goes for four over the keeper
short and wide, pushed down to third man
short outside off, backs away and cuts it hard past a diving point's left
what a shot! Good length outside off, steps out and still has to reach far ahead of his body. He does. And turns it behind square on the leg side
fired in on a good length at off stump, he wanted to turn this into the leg side but settled for a straight bat defence
full on middle, steps out and flicks it behind square, deep midwicket gets across and puts a dive to keep it to two
good length on middle, steps out and tucks it to the right of midwicket
pushed into the pads on a good length, turns it away simply for two behind square on the leg side
112 kph, slower ball full outside off, sliced to deep point
bouncer angled across the batsman, he goes for the hook but it is too big on him. Would've been a wide. But he gets enough bat and it flies fine. One bounce and four
good length, angled across him, he walks across and stabs at it. Beaten on the outside edge
good length outside off, walks across and pushes to deep midwicket
short outside off, shuffles across and whips it to the right of mid-on

full outside off, walks across his stumps again, waits for it, hangs his bat high above his shoulder and brings it down at an angle to drive it past mid-on's right. Deep midwicket has had to run a long way across
good length, wide outside off, leaves it alone
back of a length on off stump, climbs on him as he punches it into the ground. Flies high and fast to the left of Umar Akmal at point, and he puts in a dive to stop it. Good effort.
good length outside off, not short enough to cut, but he goes for it and gets four glorious runs through an inside edge through fine leg
slower ball outside off, tries to turn it through square leg, gets an inside edge again, but the keeper stops it
another inside edge! Almost looks intentional here. Good length outside off, short arm jab of an attempted cut, inside edge, four more
and now a slice through the slip cordon. Full outside off, leans back and places it to the right of first slip
good length wide outside off, walks across and slaps it in front of deep midwicket
similar line, similar length, this time he dabs it to covers and gets a single
good length on off stump, waits, opens the face, places it down to third man
good length on off, shuffles across and pushes it wide of mid-on
back of a length on middle, opens the face and runs it down to third man
walks across and gets a bouncer this time and he can't do much. Ducks under it last minute and nods at the bowler in acknowledgement

bouncer in the corridor, he steps out and cramps himself. Can't get much on his attempted hook, it hits his glove and dollies up for the keeper - who runs 10 yards to his left and dives forward to hold on to this. No dropped catch, no overstepping. He really is out, guys. Really.
superb. Angles it across the left-hander, hits middle, deviates slightly and beats his outside edge
full on middle stump this time, pushes forward and drives it solidly to mid-off
full outside off, shuffles across slightly and middles his square drive to perfection
squares him up again. Full on middle, checks his shot last minute to show the full face but gets a thick outside edge that goes to point
ooomph. Sweetly timed cover drive to this wide delivery outside off. There's a sweeper there now though
good length, wide outside off, driven off the back foot to sweeper cover
full and angled across from middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
short of a length on middle, walks across and pushes it to deep square leg
can't direct this bouncer. Good height, but down the leg side
good length outside off, climbs on him as he defends it off the back foot
full and drifting into the pads, waits on it and punches it past mid-on

short and wide outside off, slight step across and pulls it through the right of mid-on to bring up his eight century. Fabulous innings from Smith. Handled the loss of two wickets and a nervy debutant well and takes his team all the way
back of a length on off stump, punched off the back foot to deep cover
bouncer at his right shoulder, gets down nice and easy to sway away from it
short on off stump, gets on his toes and runs it down to third man
good slower ball. 119 kph, good length outside off. Smith wants to whip this through midwicket but he's into it too early and it slides between bat and pad
full on middle stump, pushed off the front foot through the covers
good length, wide outside off, slashes at it but it slips under his bat
short on middle stump, gets on top of the bounce and defends it
short and angled into the hips, jumps up and turns it down to the fine leg boundary
good length, angled in from outside off, it gets big oh him but he defends it easily
back of a length outside off, back foot defence
good length, angled in at the top of off stump, but Head is solidly behind this and defends it
slower ball, full outside off. Smith is into his drive early again, but gets bat on it this time. A turning bat though. Straight to mid-off
short on middle stump, one step across and pulls it past deep square leg. The Australian Open could use him.
good length on middle stump, gets back and pushes it to mid-on
good length off cutter on the pads, pushed with soft hands and there's no one in the infield on the leg side
back of a length on middle, steps across and pulls it to deep midwicket
good length outside off, tails in slightly and gets the inside half of the bat on his attempted defence. Single through square leg
good length, angled across off stump, pushed to deep cover
good length, wide of off stump, leaves it alone
full outside off stump, small stride in and drives it straight to cover
short and wide, frees his arms and cuts it, but straight to point
good length in a nice channel, defended to point
and that's it. Full on middle stump, moves into him slightly, and he uses the angle to punch it past mid-on
